body:
Before applying for a court order you must attend a [MIAM]({app:urls:route:professional_mediation}), unless [you're exempt](https://apply-to-court-about-child-arrangements.service.justice.gov.uk/about/miam_exemptions).

The MIAM will assess whether mediation is right for you and if you can agree arrangements out of court.

You will need to [find a mediator](https://www.familymediationcouncil.org.uk/find-local-mediator/) to book a MIAM.

Only authorised mediators can carry out a MIAM. Check with the mediator before you book.
cost: Average cost of MIAM per person
cost_description: Estimated fees may vary depending on your location and the experience of the mediator. Some mediators offer reductions if you’re unemployed or on a low income. It may also be cheaper if you attend together. If you or the other parent are eligible for legal aid you both will qualify for a free MIAM.
heading: Attend a Mediation Information and Assessment Meeting (MIAM)
